sen.j: 京都精華大前駅（きょうとせいかだいまええき）は、京都市左京区にある叡山電鉄叡山電鉄鞍馬線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in the Sakyo Ward of Kyoto City, the Kyoto Seikadaimae Station is a stop on the Kurama Line, the Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway).
Kyoto Seikadaimae Station, located in the Sakyo ward of Kyoto City, is a stop on the Kurama Line of the Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway).
Kyoto Seikadaimae Station, located in the Sakyo ward of Kyoto City, is a stop on the Kurama Line of the Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway).

sen.j: この叡山電鉄の中で最も新しい駅である。
sen.e: This station is the most beautiful among the stations of the Eizan Electric Railway.
Among the stations of the Eizan Electric Railway, this one is the most beautiful.
Among the stations of the Eizan Electric Railway, this one is the most beautiful.

sen.j: 相対式2面2線のプラットホームを持つ無人駅。
sen.e: An unmanned station with two platforms serving two tracks which face each other.
It's an unmanned station with two platforms serving two tracks that face each other.
It's an unmanned station with two platforms serving two tracks that face each other.

sen.j: 両ホームは全体が上屋で覆われており、ホームごとに上屋や柱・壁のデザインを変えている。
sen.e: The roofs cover the entire platforms, where designs of the roof, columns, and wall differ by platform.
The roofs cover the entire platforms, but the designs of the roof, columns and walls differ by platform.
The roofs cover the entirety of the platforms, but the designs of the roof, columns and walls differ by platform.

sen.j: それぞれのホームに出入り口がある。
sen.e: Each platform has an entrance.
Each platform has an entrance.
Each platform has an entrance.

sen.j: 基本は無人駅であるが大学の繁忙期（入学式や受験時）には係員が配置される。
sen.e: The station is usually unmanned and the station staff is at work during busy seasons of the university (on enrollment ceremonies and entrance examinations).
The station is usually unmanned and the station staff is at work during the busy university season (particularly during enrollment ceremonies and entrance examinations).
The station is usually unmanned and the station staff is at work during the busy university season (particularly during enrollment ceremonies and entrance examinations).

sen.j: そのため係員の詰所が両出入口の脇にある。
sen.e: There are staff rooms besides the entrances.
Staff rooms are located adjacent to the entrances.
Staff rooms are located adjacent to the entrances.

sen.j: また鞍馬駅方面行ホームには自動改札機がある。
sen.e: Automatic ticket gates are installed on the Kurama Station-bound platform.
Automatic ticket gates are installed on the Kurama Station-bound platform.
Automatic ticket gates are installed on the Kurama Station-bound platform.

sen.j: 回数券の一部は大学構内の画箋堂で発売している。
sen.e: Part of commutation tickets are sold at the Gasendo in the university.
Some of the commuter tickets are sold at the Gasendo on the university campus.
Some of the commutation tickets are sold at the Gasendo on the university campus.
sen.cmt: 回数券→commutation ticketsで既出記事と統一

sen.j: 両ホームはイタリア人の建築家、アンドレーア・パッラーディオの設計したトラス橋をもとに、京都精華大学によって建設された「パラディオ橋」によって結ばれている。
sen.e: Two platforms are connected by 'Palladio-bashi Bridge' built by the Kyoto Seika University based on the Truss Bridge designed by Andrea Palladio, an Italian architect.
Two platforms are connected by 'Palladio-bashi Bridge,' which was built by the Kyoto Seika University based on the Truss Bridge designed by Andrea Palladio, an Italian architect.
Two platforms are connected by 'Palladio-bashi Bridge,' which was built by the Kyoto Seika University based on the Truss Bridge designed by Andrea PALLADIO, an Italian architect.

sen.j: 下りホーム～住宅地、上りホーム～大学正門付近へはスロープでバリアフリーに対応しているが、反対側への移動は「パラディオ橋」のみによっており、構内や隣接の踏切がないのでかなり迂回が必要。
sen.e: From the outbound platform to the residential area, and from the inbound platform to the front gate of the university can be accessed by ramps for barrier-free design, but since only the 'Palladio-bashi Bridge' connects the platforms and there is no level crossing in the station or near the station, a person in wheel chairs needs to go the long way around.

The route from the outbound platform to the residential area, and from the inbound platform to the front gate of the university can be accessed by ramps for barrier-free design, but since only the 'Palladio-bashi Bridge' connects the platforms and there is no level crossing in the station or near the station, persons in wheelchairs need to go the long way around.

The route from the outbound platform to the residential area, and from the inbound platform to the front gate of the university can be accessed by ramps for barrier-free design, but since only the 'Palladio-bashi Bridge' connects the platforms and there is no level crossing in the station or near the station, persons in wheelchairs need to go the long way around.

sen.j: 京都精華大学のある山の斜面の裾部分に位置している。
sen.e: The station is located in the foundation of the slope of the mountain where the Kyoto Seika University lies.
The station is located at the base of the slope of the mountain where Kyoto Seika University lies.
The station is located at the base of the slope of the mountain where Kyoto Seika University lies.

sen.j: 上りホームは一部山の斜面に接している。
sen.e: The inbound platform partly touches the slope of the mountain.
The inbound platform partly touches the slope of the mountain.
The inbound platform partly touches the slope of the mountain.

sen.j: 駅名の通り、京都精華大学の最寄り駅であり、キャンパスの中心部は大学の正門からよりも近い。
sen.e: As the name shows, the station is the nearest station of the Kyoto Seika University, and from the station to the center of the campus is closer than from the center of the campus to the front gate of the university.

As the name shows, the station is the nearest one to Kyoto Seika University, and it is a shorter distance from the station to the center of the campus than it is from the center of the university campus to its front gate.

As the name shows, the station is the nearest one to Kyoto Seika University, and it is a shorter distance from the station to the center of the campus than it is from the center of the university campus to its front gate.

sen.j: まさに大学のための駅となっている。
sen.e: The station literally serves for the university.
The station literally serves the university.
The station literally serves the university.

sen.j: 反対側は狭い谷間の農耕地であった。
sen.e: The other side of the station was croplands in a narrow valley.
The other side of the station consisted of croplands in a narrow valley.
The other side of the station consisted of croplands in a narrow valley.

sen.j: 近年区画整理が進むにつれ住宅が増えてきているが、まだまだ農耕地や駐車場が目立つ。
sen.e: Recently, as the land readjustment proceeds, more residential buildings have been built, but there still remain many croplands or parking spaces.
Recently, with the progress of land readjustment, more residential buildings have been built, but numerous croplands and parking areas remain.
Recently, with the progress of land readjustment, more residential buildings have been built, but numerous croplands and parking areas remain.

sen.j: 更雀寺（雀寺）
sen.e: Kyosyaku-ji Temple (Suzume-dera)
Kyosyaku-ji Temple (Suzume-dera)
Kyoshaku-ji Temple (Suzume-dera)

sen.j: 頼光橋
sen.e: Yoritomo-bashi Bridge
Yoritomo-bashi Bridge
Yoritomo-bashi Bridge

sen.j: 京都大学演習林
sen.e: Kyoto University Enshurin (Forest Science)
Kyoto University Enshurin (Forest Science)
Kyoto University Enshurin (Forest Science)

sen.j: 総合地球環境学研究所
sen.e: Research Institute for Humanity and Nature
Research Institute for Humanity and Nature
Research Institute for Humanity and Nature

sen.j: 1989年（平成元年）9月21日 開業。
sen.e: The station opened on September 21, 1989.
The station opened on September 21, 1989.
September 21, 1989: The station opened.

sen.j: 当初は現在の上り線位置にホームを仮設。
sen.e: At first, the platform was temporarily built at the current location of the inbound line.
Originally, the platform was a temporary one built at the current location of the inbound line.
Originally, the platform was a temporary one built at the current location of the inbound line.

sen.j: 1990年（平成2年）9月28日 当駅を含む、岩倉駅 (京都府)～二軒茶屋駅 (京都府)間が再複線化。
sen.e: On September 28, 1990, the line between the Iwakura Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and the Nikenchaya Station (Kyoto Prefecture), including the Kyoto Seikadaimae Station, became a double track again.
On September 28, 1990, the line between Iwakura Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and Nikenchaya Station (Kyoto Prefecture), including Kyoto Seikadaimae Station, became a double track again.
September 28, 1990: The line between Iwakura Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and Nikenchaya Station (Kyoto Prefecture), including Kyoto Seikadaimae Station, became a double track again.

sen.j: 現在の姿となる。
sen.e: The current station completed.
The current station was completed.
The current station was completed.

sen.j: 叡山電鉄
sen.e: Eizan Electric Railway
Eizan Electric Railway
Eizan Electric Railway

sen.j: 鞍馬線
sen.e: Kurama Line
Kurama Line
Kurama Line

sen.j: 木野駅 - 京都精華大前駅 - 二軒茶屋駅 (京都府)
sen.e: Kino Station - Kyoto Seikadaimae Station - Nikenchaya Station (Kyoto Prefecture)
Kino Station - Kyoto Seikadaimae Station - Nikenchaya Station (Kyoto Prefecture)
